# Contributing to {{ORG_DISPLAY_NAME}}

Thank you for your interest in contributing to **{{ORG_DISPLAY_NAME}}**. This organization is part of the [organvm](https://github.com/{{TAXIS_ORG}}) eight-organ creative-institutional system.

## Getting Started

1. Check existing [issues](https://github.com/{{ORG_NAME}}/.github/issues) for open tasks or bugs.
2. Fork the relevant repository and create a feature branch.
3. Make your changes, following the standards below.
4. Submit a pull request for review.

## Code Standards

- Follow the existing conventions in the repository you're contributing to.
- Write clear commit messages in imperative mood, under 72 characters for the title.
- Include tests for new functionality where applicable.
- Keep changes focused and atomic â€” one concern per PR.

## Documentation

- READMEs should be written for a portfolio audience (grant reviewers, hiring managers, collaborators).
- Use relative links for cross-references within the same repository.
- Maintain consistency with the project's existing documentation style.

## Issues and Discussions

- **Bug reports**: Use the bug report issue template with reproduction steps.
- **Feature requests**: Use the feature request issue template.
- **Questions**: Open an issue with the `question` label or start a Discussion.

## Review Process

All contributions are reviewed by the project maintainers. We evaluate for:

- Correctness and code quality
- Consistency with project architecture
- Test coverage
- Documentation quality

## Code of Conduct

All contributors are expected to follow our [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). Please report unacceptable behavior to **{{CONDUCT_EMAIL}}**.

## Contact

- Support: {{SUPPORT_EMAIL}}
- Security issues: See [SECURITY.md](SECURITY.md)
